email_content:
Hi Mark,

I hope you’re doing well.

As discussed, I’m sharing a handful of simple, evidence-based strategies you can practice to help reduce everyday stress and support your overall well-being:

1. Mindful Breathing
   • Take two or three minutes to focus on slow, steady breaths (in through the nose, out through the mouth).  
   • Let your attention rest on the feeling of the air moving and your chest rising and falling.  
   • If your mind wanders, gently guide it back to the breath.

2. Progressive Muscle Relaxation
   • Starting with your feet and moving upward, briefly tense each muscle group for about five seconds and then release.  
   • Notice the contrast between tension and relaxation.  
   • A full body scan can take just a few minutes and helps release built-up physical stress.

3. Short Movement Breaks
   • Stand, stretch, or take a brief walk every hour or two.  
   • Even two minutes of movement can boost circulation and shift your mood.

4. Mindfulness Moments
   • Choose an ordinary activity (sipping water, washing hands) and bring full attention to the sensations, sights, and sounds in that moment.  
   • This small practice helps train the mind to stay present instead of spinning into worry.

5. Unplug Wind-Down
   • Set aside screens for at least 30 minutes before rest.  
   • Use the time for light reading, gentle stretching, or calming music to signal to your mind and body that it’s time to settle.

You might pick one or two of these and try them consistently for a week, then notice any changes in how you feel. Let me know how they fit into your routine or if you’d like variations tailored to your day-to-day schedule.

Take care,

[Your Name]
